Text:
A lot of Americans are employed in the gig economy, but are ineligible for benefit programs because old models don’t fit an evolving workforce. I’ve introduced a bill to address that and test out models to better connect these workers to benefits.
https://t.co/s9oDgPjjMB

Putin’s aggression will disrupt the international economy and cause higher prices – especially on gas and food – for Americans. That’s one reason I’ve been working to address this situation, meeting with diplomats in Munich and getting briefings back home.

Starting her teaching career at age 16, Virginia Randolph went on to become one of the most influential educators in Virginia’s history, working on a project to upgrade vocational education across the American southeast. She also fostered over 50 children throughout her life. https://t.co/qyecsqDGLy
https://t.co/3CROEnTb1J

We need more transparency online. That’s why I’m fighting for reforms that would give you more info about how much your data is worth to Big Tech, eradicate dark patterns aimed at children, and level the playing field for smaller tech companies.
Folks, this tax season has the potential to see significant delays. I’m advocating for improvements to the IRS, but if you want to receive your return as soon as possible, file early and online.
It’s past time for the Senate to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act.

I’m extremely focused on Ukraine because a full Russian invasion would be a threat to the Ukrainian people and democracies globally, and could raise prices for gas, food & other essentials in America. 

I’m working to keep costs low, and part of that is addressing this situation.

Glad to see the IRS cancelling plans to close a processing facility in Austin – I directly advocated for this alongside a bipartisan group of senators to prevent additional delays in processing tax returns.

As the Olympics come to a close, I want to highlight another Virginian Olympian – Gabby Douglas, a two-time U.S. gymnastics team member and the first-ever Black woman All-Around Gymnastics Champion. Rewatch her winning 2012 routines here: https://t.co/3vWULCJnfy https://t.co/QyJe1vAli2

I’m joining @TimKaine in asking the Biden admin to press the CCP to release the family members of several Virginians – Uyghurs who have been forcibly and wrongfully detained in China. We’ll keep fighting for the rule of democracy and human rights globally.

I’m in Munich today meeting with diplomats and receiving briefings on the situation in Ukraine. There is still an off-ramp here for Putin, but make no mistake: the U.S. and our allies will stand with the people of Ukraine, one way or another.

I’m glad to see the Biden admin move quickly on this & stay alert to all forms of aggression towards Ukraine. We need to be on guard against the potential for more cyber attacks – and the potential for these to affect Americans & our allies – as diplomatic negotiations continue. https://t.co/mDZaf2HVUf
The USPS affects every American – and for too long it’s been struggling to provide consistent, on-time delivery. I’m supporting a bill to help change that.

Dr. Robert Walter “Whirlwind” Johnson – known as the father of Black tennis – trained many tennis stars at his home court in Lynchburg. He supported and created opportunities for legends like Althea Gibson and Arthur Ashe, and paved the way to integrate tennis. https://t.co/QN4R59ctjB
I’m glad we were able to pass a continuing resolution to avert a government shutdown yesterday – but we need to stop doing these stopgap solutions and actually pass a full spending bill.

Rent and housing prices are out of control – this is one of the most major drivers of inflation, and I want to tackle it. That’s why I’m pushing for long- and short-term solutions, like tax benefits that will to help incentivize construction and end the housing shortage. https://t.co/y1KwMrgm7f

Born in Newport News, Ella Fitzgerald remains one of the great talents of American music – winning 14 Grammy Awards, the National Medal of Arts, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom. She inspired a generation of musicians and reshaped jazz, bebop, and scatting for all singers. https://t.co/booxE7aRjI

Today, I led a bipartisan group to reintroduce a bill that would allow the DOL to test portable benefit designs for gig workers. We need a benefits model that fits the 21st century, and this program would help us better support an evolving workforce.

6 million Americans are still waiting on their returns from last filing season – that’s unacceptable. Today I joined a hearing about the IRS to push for real solutions about what the IRS can be doing to get returns to Americans faster. https://t.co/ocBQc7KUPK
I will continue to monitor the situation in Ethiopia and remain committed to supporting increased access to humanitarian aid and a resolution to the ongoing conflict. (2/2)

This morning, I spoke on the phone with US officials on the ground in Addis Ababa. I’m pleased to see the Ethiopian parliament lift the state of emergency, visas issued to humanitarian workers, and the release of opposition leaders. (1/2)

I’m carefully monitoring the situation in Ukraine because it has the potential to impact all Americans. I’m standing with @POTUS as he uses every tool available to solve this crisis diplomatically.
https://t.co/58nUy2n3VY

But it’s not just infrastructure – other priorities, like the CDC, DoD, and universities could also lose out. It’s critical that we pass a full spending bill and not just more continuing resolutions. I’m going to keep pushing for this.
To make it even more specific, projects like restoring the historic Mayo Bridge in Richmond could miss out on $5 million in funding. https://t.co/0VEMXu6eEq

Unfortunately, a lot of this funding is dependent on Congress passing a comprehensive omnibus bill – a bill that authorizes funding for new projects. Virginia alone could lose approximately $364 million in roads and bridges funding and $53 million in transit funding.
Not to mention, all of this (and more): https://t.co/NcmIrCr0us
Hey folks, a quick reminder about funding the infrastructure law has already secured for Virginia (THREAD): https://t.co/Jh0YuC8ISB
We can’t just talk about inflation – it’s time to do something about it. My Republican colleagues should stop the obstruction and confirm critical Fed nominees. #FedFiveNow

I was proud that December’s defense bill bumped up paid family leave for members of the military. We need stronger family leave policies for all workers, but this is a great first step in expanding that benefit for our servicemembers. https://t.co/nREqtcZKRM

A Richmond native and Air Force vet, Max Robinson broke barriers by becoming the first Black man to anchor a local news network and a nightly news broadcast, before creating an organization that would eventually become the National Association for Black Journalists. https://t.co/RNmTaRDZOK

Last year, I made it a priority to visit USPS facilities and push for accountability about delays. But issues persist, and that’s why I’ll be supporting the USPS reform bill. This crucial agency needs support and reform so it can operate better for all. https://t.co/B3iwU8LYCE

After repeated lobbying for more federal support, we’ve received another victory for those impacted by the flooding in Hurley: almost $175,000 in relief from the Appalachian Regional Commission. I’m not going to leave any community in VA behind.

I’m monitoring Russia’s potential for cyber attacks closely, especially since it could lead to spillover effects for America or other NATO countries, like the NotPetya attack did in 2017. I’ll stay vigilant on this as we confront Russian aggression of all types. https://t.co/97SXSb371K

Every Virginian child deserves a world-class education – I’ll keep supporting legislation and programs that make that happen.
https://t.co/kVIB4GX3uS
In my capacity as Chair of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, I joined with bipartisan leaders to issue the following statement of solidarity with Ukraine: https://t.co/5dSnMHMflR

Disappointed in my Republican colleagues for skipping these votes today and delaying critical Fed confirmations. Americans need a strong, fully-staffed Fed to continue our economic recovery. 

I came ready to work and ready to vote. https://t.co/X2hf2S3IlY

Today, I want to honor Barbara Johns – a native of Prince Edward County, Johns attended a segregated school and organized a protest of its substandard conditions. As a result of her protest, the NAACP sued the school in a case that eventually was included in Brown v. Board. https://t.co/gEMEs3JcTd

I know it may not sound like the most exciting legislation, but our reaction to the semiconductor shortage will determine the economic future of America. It’s time to get my CHIPS Act signed into law.
https://t.co/XZPvT5ZLee

Our NATO allies are united, and every single day leaders are meeting in Kyiv or Moscow to address Russia’s aggression. I joined FOX News and spoke on the floor of the Senate today to provide updates on the situation: https://t.co/r4azBJfDhU

I want to be clear: In the event of an unwarranted, unjustified and illegitimate attack on Ukraine, the United States will stand with the people of Ukraine. I'll be discussing the ongoing situation in a speech on the Senate floor. Tune in: https://t.co/28u2X5dgKq

The Postal Service delivers vital medications, benefits, and bills – it’s critical for all Americans. 

A lot of reforms need to be made, but we should start by passing the Postal Service reform bill.
The Violence Against Women Act is a critical piece of legislation that protects victims of domestic violence and saves lives. It’s past time to reauthorize it and #SupportSurvivors.

Next up, I want to honor Zora Neale Hurston, an author whose work powerfully captured the life of Black Americans. In addition to her acclaimed novels, plays, and essays, Hurston was also an anthropologist who conducted multidisciplinary research globally. https://t.co/ppHnLwAru0
Folks, I’m closely monitoring the situation in Ukraine. Here’s my latest rundown on the issue. https://t.co/zPxrE9T8hK

Some Americans are stuck paying for their former partner’s student loans – including victims of domestic violence. I’m working on a bill to change that.
https://t.co/L8LmS2MSHi
Send these valentines to your special someone – you’re welcome! https://t.co/bzpumE8yfN
My Valentine of over three decades and counting. Happy Valentine’s Day, Lisa! https://t.co/q04jYA5MVO

The bipartisan infrastructure law is taking steps towards protecting our climate by:
🔌 Building more electric vehicle charging stations
⛏️ Cleaning up old mines + curbing pollution
🚌 Investing in public transportation

On the anniversary of the founding of the NAACP, I want to honor Ida B. Wells, one of the founders, and a journalist, suffragist, and activist whose writings brought attention to the horrors of lynching, the need for reform in America’s cities, and the indignity of segregation. https://t.co/EysBlVoc1P

I’ll always have the backs of small business owners – that’s why I’m working on a bipartisan law alongside @SenatorHassan and @SenatorTimScott to reinstate the Employee Retention Tax Credit – a critical benefit that helps cover costs for small businesses.

Today, I want to briefly highlight some legislation I’ve introduced to close the racial wealth gap – my LIFT Act would help first-time homeowners (predominantly people of color) shorten mortgages and build equity faster. It’s one step we can take towards ending this gap.

Forced arbitration clauses prevent workers that have been sexually harassed from being able to use all tools to seek justice. Yesterday, we passed a law to end them and allow survivors to bring their claims to court – accomplishing one of the largest workplace reforms in decades.

This week I got a perfect 100% from the Humane Society for my efforts to support legislation that protects animals. Here’s to another year of meeting pets all across the Commonwealth and passing laws that keep them safe. https://t.co/DIiQkTIbxU

The bipartisan infrastructure law is an investment in a greener, more accessible future. With this announcement, Virginia can spread more electric vehicle charging stations across the Commonwealth. https://t.co/MvPp74WGkR

Today I want to highlight Amanda Gorman – the first-ever National Youth Poet Laureate, the inaugural poet, and an activist, author, and speaker. Her poetry speaks for itself: https://t.co/FYWO2vNgG2 https://t.co/Sk1H2cMt8R

Earlier this week, I got a chance to talk to @Surgeon_General about our bipartisan efforts to pass the DETOUR Act – which would prevent dark patterns from luring you into clicking or subscribing to things you don’t want. It’s time to pass this law and support online transparency. https://t.co/aIdF8kuW9G

Glad to see @POTUS make a stop in Culpeper today to talk about lowering health care costs – it’s time for Congress to take meaningful action to address lowering prescription drug prices. It isn’t fair that families are spending huge portions of their income on life-saving drugs.

I’m pleased the House took action on this – advocating for reforms to USPS has been a top priority for me, and this bill is a step in the right direction towards making USPS run better for all Americans.
https://t.co/cg6DZ1wSsP

The bipartisan infrastructure law is the gift that keep on giving… for communities all across Virginia and for the next decade.

This week we announced $22 million to help reclaim and clean up abandoned mine lands across Virginia. https://t.co/EfgyC4gFbF

Today I want to highlight Maame Biney – a Restonian and an Olympian representing Team USA this week. She was the first Black woman to qualify for the US speedskating team back in 2018 and is competing in Beijing this year. Good luck on your remaining events, Maame! https://t.co/4km9yGwuOb

Today, as chair of the Intel Committee, I led all our members in a letter to @POTUS urging maximum intelligence sharing with Ukraine. Russia’s threats to Ukraine are a threat to democracies globally, and we must do as much as possible to support Ukraine at this critical moment. https://t.co/FS3RcjopwD

Glad to see Scott Nathan confirmed as head of @DFCgov – I know he’ll bring a great range of expertise to the role and continue leading the agency as it helps alleviate poverty and support small business owners globally.
We should honor #BlackHistoryMonth by passing voting rights legislation that meaningfully restores the Voting Rights Act and ensures that Black voters have equal opportunity to cast their vote.

I’ll always support our business community here in Virginia, especially during the pandemic. I met with Black-owned business leaders in Arlington last week to discuss how Congress can best continue to support small businesses.
https://t.co/2n861iSjqY
If you are stuck in a joint consolidation loan that you wish to separate, please reach out to my team: https://t.co/1KOasgGvsw

Proud to be a champion for student loan borrowers saddled with the debt of their former partners, including survivors of domestic violence. @JohnCornyn, @SenTinaSmith, @Marcorubio, @RepDavidEPrice and I won’t stop until we deliver long-overdue relief by passing this bill into law https://t.co/XjUeDv00Iu
There are still 6 million unprocessed tax returns from the 2020 filing year. That’s unacceptable, and I’m keeping the pressure on the IRS to do better and get folks their returns.
This is big news – so many contributed to these efforts and I’m proud we were able to conclude the resettlement of Afghan refugees living in Virginia. https://t.co/lad5gBFlW9

During #BlackHistoryMonth, it’s also important to continue to speak up about how a history of discriminatory policy has hurt Black Americans – and advocate for change. This article from @BrookingsInst charts and examines the racial wealth gap. https://t.co/nNEGpe69iR

Last Friday, I headed out to survey a bridge that’s been having problems for months. Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law, this bridge – and hundreds just like it, all over the Commonwealth – are going to see improvements. https://t.co/mVydIHkfeY

It's important to me to represent all corners of Virginia. This week, we secured some wins for SWVA:
⛏️ $22 million for cleaning up abandoned mines
📍Victims of flooding in Buchanan County will be able to apply for assistance through the SBA

Today, I want to highlight the contributions of Thurgood Marshall. Prior to his time as a justice, Marshall founded the NAACP Legal Defense Fund and argued the case Brown v. Board of Education in front of SCOTUS. His legacy forever challenged segregation and changed the court. https://t.co/8yqAKzriYw

ICYMI: our push on accountability for Amtrak worked, and they admitted to critical mistakes during January’s winter storms. But I’ll continue monitoring this, and making sure they continue to do better moving forwards.  https://t.co/LkkN5AojyC

I appreciated the opportunity to get to join a roundtable of Black-owned businesses last Friday – small business owners contribute so much to the economy and culture of VA, and I am working to make sure they continue getting the federal help necessary to get through the pandemic. https://t.co/MBX6KMRdCe

Proud to receive a score of a perfect 100% from the Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights due to my voting record in this session! Passing legislation that supports and uplifts all communities will always be critical to me.

I’m no stranger to being around strong women – at home and in Congress. So it was great to get to keep that going by speaking at the AWE Women in Business Summit last Friday and discuss what Congress is working on right now for small business. https://t.co/0C5jxyqG0e
Incredibly saddened to see another act of gun violence in the Commonwealth this week. My heart is with the people of Blacksburg and the entire Virginia Tech community.

On her birthday, I want to honor the courage and bravery of Rosa Parks. A passionate advocate and dedicated community member, Parks’ story continued beyond the Montgomery Bus Boycott – she also worked for a congressman and organized for the rights of prisoners. https://t.co/eqmK8XfwBR

Today, I got to visit the Arlington Ridge Road Bridge – one of the 577 bridges in Virginia in poor condition. Our bipartisan infrastructure law is going to change that, and I’m looking forward to seeing improvements to this bridge and bridges all across VA as a result. https://t.co/gFeQhP51MR

The infrastructure law is securing major changes for all parts of VA – we’re investing major federal funds on building safer roads and closing the digital divide. This is a transformative, once-in-a-generation law. https://t.co/Z9DDsj0sHX

ICYMI – there are 577 bridges across the Commonwealth in poor condition – but thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law, $537 million is coming to VA to change that. No matter where you live, it’ll keep you safer and make travel easier. https://t.co/ieBKAfHkor

Last week I joined with a few of my colleagues to advocate for this change. This week, it’s happening. Thankful to secure wins that make health care more accessible and affordable during this pandemic. https://t.co/bub2XG7eeu
@TommyMcFLY @timkaine https://t.co/Lc2mY0wM9U

I joined @TommyMcFLY to walk a mile together and discuss everything from my bipartisan biking partners to my my favorite spots in Alexandria to my REAL thoughts on @TimKaine… tune in. https://t.co/GdRzwecdOO

I’m proud of the diplomatic unity our allies have shown as we confront Russia’s armed build-up around Ukraine – we’re using all the tools at our disposal, including a strengthened NATO. Today, I joined CNN to provide an update on our response. https://t.co/Zly1AJ6dxN

When we passed the infrastructure bill, we secured real improvements for every corner of the Commonwealth – roads, airports, bridges, ports, broadband expansion, and more. It’ll be a decade of real, positive change. https://t.co/sXySB6mRXR

On the anniversary of the 15th Amendment, I want to pay tribute to one of its greatest advocates, Frederick Douglass. Douglass was an abolitionist, suffragist, and author whose work was incredibly influential in shaping the public and political discussion around abolition. https://t.co/pvsqClcGGr

“In fact, [Biden’s] lower-court appointees are arguably more highly qualified… than the judges selected by previous presidents…”
 
Appreciated this data-driven look into the judicial nominees we’ve confirmed so far.
https://t.co/DZfWpOZnIR
I was moved to read about the victims of the Bridgewater College shooting, Officers Painter and Jefferson. I’m thinking of all those who have been affected by their loss. https://t.co/hESMON99Jn

On the anniversary of the ratification of the amendment that gave Black men the right to vote, I’m thinking about the ways our democracy has always needed constant maintenance.
 
I’m still actively working to protect voting rights.

Glad to see the rollout of the @DHSgov Cyber Safety Review Board. It’s a matter of when, not if, we face another widespread cyber breach that threatens our national security. I look forward to closely monitoring the development of this board.

ISIS remains a clear global threat, and while any loss of life is tragic, active terrorists need to understand they will be hunted down. I appreciate the bravery of the U.S. forces involved and look forward to getting further briefings. https://t.co/gQvdQVrAsq

I’m deeply disturbed by the bomb threats against HBCUs — these acts of attempted terror are clear reminders that violent extremism and white supremacy are on the rise. I’ve requested a briefing and remain committed to combatting hate in all its forms.
Love these Virginia entrepreneurial instincts, the public health amplification, and the fun pitch. Henrico County represent! https://t.co/eWc3QweY8g

I’m thinking about my mom on what would have been her 95th birthday. She was an incredible, vibrant, and friendly woman, and she made an indelibly positive effect on all those that knew her. A few years ago, I wrote about her life and how it shaped me.
https://t.co/LNrBUW9VA7 https://t.co/z9Z6NEiJUb
Already rooting for both of the Washington Commanders. https://t.co/eZa6doj1ri

Today I want to highlight Maya Angelou, an incredible author, poet, and activist. Her work has challenged, inspired, and moved generations of Americans, and her talents lives on through an enormous, powerful body of work. Enjoy this short poem: https://t.co/7X9xclai8Q https://t.co/4iMv8UlDxV

Excellent news! The final Afghan refugees living at military bases in Virginia have been successfully resettled! Extending my greatest thanks to all the many individuals and organizations involved. We’ll keep supporting our Afghan allies at a federal level.

Incredibly saddened to hear that two officers were killed today at Bridgewater College. My heart is with their families and the entire Bridgewater community. 

Gun violence is a tragic epidemic, so we must move forward intending to do more than just offering thoughts and prayers.
Continuing to closely monitor the situation at Bridgewater College and am grateful for the efforts of first responders already on the scene. Praying for all involved.

We’re working through some judicial nominations in the Senate this week. I’m proud that we’ve worked efficiently to confirm some extremely qualified judges – including confirming more public defenders in Biden's first year than the first years of the last 4 presidents combined.

First up, Mary McLeod Bethune! Among other achievements, Bethune founded several organizations and schools, registered women to vote just after achieving suffrage, served in the FDR Administration and as a VP for the NAACP, and was the only Black woman at the UN founding. https://t.co/nfpMMwztRa

This #BlackHistoryMonth should remind us that it’s critical to always uplift Black stories, speak up about continued injustice, and celebrate Black history. I’ll be using this thread to do so, follow along below:
Happy Lunar New Year to all celebrating! May the Year of the Water Tiger usher in prosperity, vitality, and strength for you and your family!
Access to abortion is a fundamental part of health care. That’s why I’m advocating for a permanent end to the Global Gag Rule and codifying Roe into law by passing the Women’s Health Protection Act.
Virginia, here’s what the bipartisan infrastructure law has done for you lately: https://t.co/8DjyglaPr8

I’ve secured $182 million total in federal support over the last year that will directly help Virginians pay for outstanding heating and cooling bills, because I know utilities can be a real strain, especially this time of year.

Appreciate working alongside a bipartisan group led by @AmyKlobuchar and @ChuckGrassley to achieve commonsense goals and help foster healthy competition in Big Tech. A lot to get done in 2022, and we’re just getting started. https://t.co/IcG60RFU4W

Today marks the anniversary of the first ever Social Security check being issued – a revolutionary program that’s helped countless American over 8 decades. Alongside @RonWyden @SenBobCasey and others, I’m advocating for improvements to their services and field offices.
Considering pardoning Jan. 6 rioters is a clear and public endorsement of violence and sedition. This is an abhorrent — but not surprising — statement by 45. https://t.co/AjOJJrCywn

ICYMI: VA is getting $20 million to support the eventual construction of 180 wind turbines off the coast of Virginia Beach! I was proud to help advocate for this money, and proud that VA leads on clean energy.
https://t.co/HYVTd5C9ev
Thinking of all affected by the bridge collapse in Pittsburgh. Investments in our nation’s infrastructure are more critical now than ever.

The Global Gag Rule prevents health care providers internationally from providing care and services to the most vulnerable. I’m joining my friend @SenatorShaheen in calling for the permanent end of the Mexico City Policy to protect quality care.

Glad to see this effort from @POTUS, carrying through on our work from the defense bill. There’s much more to be done to tackle this critical issue – we’re going to keep pushing. https://t.co/6LkjqsElV9
This didn’t just happen – it’s a result of the incredible investment we made in our economy when we passed the American Rescue Plan. https://t.co/kTsWXNWCyw

The American Rescue Plan just keeps on giving: today, NEA shared its final round of grants for VA as a result of the law. A total of $2.4 million is going to colleges, counties, and organizations for programs that support the arts. It’s yet another win for the Commonwealth.
I hope 2022 is the year we finally address these questions and create a more equitable internet. https://t.co/bydQWYbc0Z

70 million Americans rely on Social Security and Supplemental Security Income, so it’s imperative that they run as smoothly as possible – that’s why I’ve joined a letter to push the Acting Commissioner to address delays and improve service. https://t.co/Pfa9cEfdPR

On the two-year anniversary of Virginia ratifying the ERA, I’m calling on my colleagues to pass bipartisan legislation to extend the time frame to ratify it. We can’t let an arbitrary deadline stop the progress we’ve made towards this amendment.

On International Holocaust Remembrance Day, I’m standing in solidarity with the Jewish community in Virginia and across the United States. 

We must never forget the millions of lives lost and must always remain vigilant against anti-Semitism in all its forms.

With the bipartisan infrastructure law, we’re unlocking a decade of critical improvements to our roads, bridges, internet service, airports, electric vehicle charging stations, ports, and more. It’s creating American jobs and securing real wins for Virginians.

Proud to join my friend @SenatorWarnock as he pushes for answers from DoD about a housing contractor that committed fraud. Advocating for military housing has long been a top priority for me, and I’ll continue to try and secure the best conditions I can for our servicemembers. https://t.co/2SVFu8Mbh7

I’m very grateful to Justice Breyer for his nearly 30 years of service on SCOTUS. His distinguished career serves as a model for all who seek to strengthen democracy. I trust @POTUS will carefully select a replacement, and I look forward to closely reviewing their qualifications.
I’m not giving up on voting rights. I’m still working to get something done.

Yesterday I announced $20 million for the Appalachian Development Highway System – which will go directly towards the roads connecting our Appalachian communities to the interstate system. This is a pro-growth move for Appalachia and Virginia.

Unemployment in Virginia fell to 3.2% yesterday – another drop and a clear sign of the economic recovery that was made possible by our American Rescue Plan last year. 

I’ll keep voting for policies that get Virginians back to work.
https://t.co/EC8GJ2ovdY

BREAKING: Virginia is getting $20 million for improvements to roads across Appalachia thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law! It’s yet another investment in making ALL parts of the Commonwealth safer and more connected. https://t.co/CN0KBU7dGy

23% of Virginians are eligible for the Affordable Connectivity Program, a monthly benefit from the bipartisan infrastructure law that makes internet more affordable for Virginians that meet certain economic conditions. Find out if you’re eligible at:
https://t.co/1fsmFGyYuv

Another win for Virginia: alongside @TimKaine, I’m announcing $2 million for VA orgs that provide housing counseling in the Commonwealth – a set of resources that help tenants & homeowners manage finances and the responsibilities of tenancy to prevent foreclosure or eviction.

VIRGINIA: if you’re looking for a test, this tool lets you filter by location, pediatric testing, rapid testing, Spanish language, and more. Do your part and get tested when you can. https://t.co/KdtRXvmPOF

Climate change is already here, and it’s hurting families in many ways – like bigger utility bills due to more extreme temperatures. 

I’m proud to have voted for $182 million in federal support this year to directly help Virginians pay outstanding heating and cooling bills.
2022 is the year we’re finally going to take steps towards meaningful Big Tech reform: promoting competition, leveling the playing field, and making the internet a safer, fairer place.

Today, I wrote a letter to Secretary of the Treasury and the IRS commissioner to raise concern about the delays some of my constituents have faced receiving their 2020 tax returns. This is an unacceptable delay, and I plan to keep pushing for answers.

Houthis intentionally firing missiles at civilian targets in UAE is a tactic of terrorists. The UN Security Council should condemn the attacks as such and the Biden administration should explore labeling them as a Foreign Terrorist Organization.
Every Virginian deserves access to clean water, safe roads and bridges, and affordable, high-speed internet. The bipartisan infrastructure law is making that a reality.
Appreciate these words from The Virginian-Pilot and the Daily Press’ editorial boards – I’m proud to have secured this transformative funding. https://t.co/sibbhxMMpy https://t.co/APyeVdICL3

I’m proud to have gotten my bipartisan CHIPS bill through the Senate: it’s an anti-inflation bill, a pro-jobs bill, and a pro-research bill. I’m urging the House to get it done. https://t.co/F7Kkbaf1eK
Easy, fast, and free: https://t.co/vRF8WUQWNm
Protect Roe v. Wade.

Health care workers are heroes, and their mental health matters. We can help by slowing the spread of COVID, and I’m proud that because of ARP funding I voted for, UVA, GMU and VCU are receiving more than $5.5m for initiatives to support health care worker mental health.

I’m in Richmond today meeting with the Governor’s Broadband Advisory Council. I’ve secured billions in federal support for broadband, and with that plus state investments, we’re on track to being the first state with universal broadband coverage. https://t.co/byEAPo7i8S
Chuck and I tweet very differently, but we’re collaborating because we share a common goal on this one: helping foster healthy competition in the tech marketplace. https://t.co/XF55oso0Uc

Americans are broadly united on keeping dark money out of politics – it just makes sense. On its 12th anniversary, I am reaffirming the need to #EndCitizensUnited and restore transparency to campaign finance.

Tomorrow marks the anniversary of Roe v. Wade – but access to safe, legal abortion has never been in more danger. 

It’s time to codify Roe and ensure it remains law.

Our COVID response needs to factor in the needs of ALL communities – that’s why I’m glad the Chickahominy Eastern Division and the Nansemond Indian Nation are receiving over $2 million to support their public health responses.

Proud to serve as a cosponsor on this bipartisan initiative to level the playing field for smaller tech businesses and impose sensible regulation on bigger tech companies. 

As a former tech business guy, it’s important to me to work on legislation that helps create competition. https://t.co/2jyZRvT5iI

The money from the bipartisan infrastructure law keeps rolling in. This week: $369 million for port and resiliency projects across the Commonwealth.
 
Thanks to this law, we’re keeping Virginia a leader on ports.
A portion of my statement on the interim CIA assessment on Havana syndrome. You can find my full comments here: https://t.co/P6FFotjZeM https://t.co/jW98Ru3bSN
